metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43528 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Thunderbird unexpectedly enabled JavaScript in the composition area. The JavaScript execution context was limited to this area and did not receive chrome-level privileges, but could be used as a stepping stone to further an attack with other vulnerabilities. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.4.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43528` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
